entries.name: Age
entries: Ravenfolk reach adulthood at around 15 years of age. They live around 80 years

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The hunter culture is everything for a Ravenfolk. Meaning they respect their prey and enjoy pursuing it in nature. This respect for nature translates to a Neutral alignment, for as long as it is part of nature the Ravenfolk see it as correct and expected.

entries.name: Size
entries: Ravenfolk usually range between 4.5 and 6.5 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Hunting Heritage
entries: Thanks to the hunting culture, even a non dedicated Ravenfolk heard tales and stories about how to hunt and thrive in a forest. You have advantage on all Survival and Nature checks made on jungle, forests, or if it relates to hunting beasts.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the jungle and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You cannot discern colour in darkness,only shades of grey.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

entries.name: On the Hunt
entries: If you take the Attack action on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra 1d6 damage to it. On your next turn, you have Advantage with Attack Rolls against the original target. You can use this trait only once per combat.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common. The way you speak it among Ravenfolk has a musical cadence to it.

entries.name: Age
entries: Crimson Elves reach adulthood at around 20 years of age and live for around 700 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The strange rituals and relationships with creatures and flesh might make the Crimson Elves society seem evil from the eyes of outsiders, but their intentions are of balance and perpetuation of the nature of the Blood Moon. This tends the scale to a neutral view of the world for most of the Crimson Elves.

entries.name: Size
entries: Crimson Elves usually range between 4.5 and 6.5 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Crimson Heritage
entries: The stories and myths around the Blood Moon elevate the crimson heritage into spirituality and a form of worship. Through tales and stories, you learned about the anatomy and functions of the body as well as how to study and learn more on your own. You have advantage on all Medicine checks as long as you use it on a creature in which you have killed and absorbed a Soul Sliver from another creature of the same species.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic cannot put you to sleep.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Blood Ritual - Reaping of Souls.
entries: This basic Blood Ritual is taught to all young Crimson Elves as the beginning of their spiritual journey. Whenever you kill a creature, you may spend one minute performing a ritual to capture their blood and add it to your own body, obtaining power. Whenever you perform the ritual, you gain 1 Soul Sliver. You may spend 1 Soul Sliver as a Bonus Action to heal 1d4 Hit Points or add 1d4 Necrotic Damage to any damage roll you perform. You can hold up to 3 Soul Slivers within your blood.

entries.name: Moon Trance
entries: Crimson Elves do not need to sleep; instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is “trance.”) While meditating, you dream of the Blood Moon; such dreams are a communion to the moon, a form of prayer and tribute.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common as well the Crimson Language used to diffuse Blood Ritual.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-Estalar are considered adults around the age of 200 and can live to be a 1000 years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Due to their ancestry, the Half-Estalar usually prefer to watch over things than to be involved directly and, therefore take a neutral stance on most matters. There are those among them that have witnessed enough to know when it is the right time to intervene.

entries.name: Size
entries: Crimson Elves usually range between 4.5 and 6.5 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Ancient Heritage
entries: You have advantage on all History and Nature checks made on subjects that concern things that have been in place for more than a 100 years.

entries.name: Advanced Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the various amounts of light that can exist in various parts of the galaxy, the Half-Estalar can naturally see in dark and dim Conditions. You can see in both dim light and Darkness as if it were bright light. Also, your eyes faintly glow in the dark.

entries.name: Observer of the Cosmos
entries: The Half-Estalar's unique anatomy, specifically the ornaments that are part of their head, allows them to perceive sound much easier than other creatures. They can hear at double the distances compared to a normal human. You have Proficiency in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Always Watching
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being Blinded, and magic can't make you Deafened.

entries.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: You can telepathically communicate with a creature that is within 5 feet of you. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency. You regain all the charges for this trait after a Short or Long Rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Celestial, and one more language of your choice. You can recognize a few words in Estalarian, but you cannot comprehend more than that due to how ancient and unknown the language is.

subclassFeature.name: Stalwart Defender
entries: Ancient paintings left behind showcase the movement, the posture, and the methods of how one should hold their shields high and protect those around the, Many schools of Stalwart Defenders can be found on the site of ancient ruins, trying to make sense of this fighting style of old.

entries.name: Stalwart Shields - Sun and Moon
entries: Beginning when you choose this archetype at 3rd level you learn the secret of the paintings, the Stalwart Shield's martial art. You may dual wield shields and whenever you do, select one to be the Sun shield and the other becomes the Moon shield.

• Sun Shield. You may attack using this shield as an improvised weapon that causes 1d8 Bludgeoning Damage and, if you do so, add your proficiency to the attack roll. Whenever you cause damage with the Sun Shield, you may push the target 5 feet away from you.

• Moon Shield. You can use your reaction to make an enemy reroll an attack aimed at you or any friendly creature in a 5-foot radius around you. You can only receive the Shield AC Bonus from the Moon Shield that you are wielding, and you receive a +1 to your attacks as long as you wield a Sun Shield paired with the Moon Shield.

subclassFeature.name: Eclipse Technique
entries: Starting at 7th level, you learn to position the Moon Shield in front of the Sun shield, hiding its approach before you attack with it. As long as you are holding the Sun Shield and the Moon Shield, you can add your shield AC bonus to any damage roll caused by your Melee Attacks using the Sun Shield. You may use your Sun Shield attack as a Bonus Action.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Defender
entries: At 10th level, you have embodied the heroes depicted in the legends, inspiring those around you. As long as you are holding the sun and moon shield pair, any friendly creature in a 10-foot radius around you shares the Armour Class bonus provided by your shield. If you or any friendly creature in this radius is hit by a melee attack, the target of that attack may spend a reaction to shove a creature 5 feet away from them as long as they are in range of their melee attacks. Finally, each friendly creature within range (this includes you) has advantage on Wisdom saving throws and death saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Presence
entries: Starting at 15th level, your presence in the battlefield can be felt by all. You may spend a reaction to reposition yourself, moving your full speed in the direction of a friendly creature, then if any hostile creatures are in range of your melee attacks, you may immediately make a melee attack against that hostile creature.

subclassFeature.name: Ancient Survivor
entries: At 18th level, you embody the hope expected from an ancient Stalwart Defender. At the start of each of your turns, you and any friendly creature in a 10-foot radius around you are inspired to keep on fighting, regaining Hit Points equal to your Proficiency modifier if you have more than half of your Hit Points left.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Stars
entries: The Oath of Stars binds a paladin to a life of absolute dedication towards the Astral Siblings. Ukko and Umi never reveal themselves to mortals unless it is necessary, so when it comes to a paladin being contacted by one of the two deities, it is considered a huge blessing and honor.

entries.name: 1/Day
entries: As an action, you can imbue one weapon you are holding with Starlight Magic using your Channel Divinity. This effect lasts for 2 minutes or until you are no longer wielding the weapon. The effects of this infusion vary based on various conditions:

rows: Your weapon emits a bright yellow light in a 30-foot radius and dim light 10 feet beyond that. You gain a +2 to all of your attack rolls.
You weapon emits a dim white light in a 20-foot radius. You gain +2 to all of your saving throws while wielding this weapon.
Your weapon takes the colour of the nightsky, with stars shining dimly on it. You gain a +1 to your AC.

entries.name: 3/Day
entries: As a Bonus Action, you may focus on harnessing the powers of Starlight Magic all around you to empower your next spell, attack, or action. The effect can vary based on your level. It is up to the GM's discretion when it comes to various actions, though Advantage is suggested if a roll is needed for the success of said actions. For attacks and spells, a bonus to hit equal to the proficiency and a number d6 Radiant damage dice equal to the proficiency is suggested.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Stars Spells
rows: {@spell Child of the Siblings|BensBrew}, {@spell Planar Binding}

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Stars
entries: A paladin who wishes to become a Starlight Knight must dedicate themselves to a life of righteousness and justice. In many cases, this can be translated in different ways; not every Starlight Knight has the same understanding of justice, but all of them are of a good alignment.

Unlike other Oaths, the Oath of Stars allows the paladin to empower themselves with Starlight magic, so they may not only face danger, but also avoid it. The most important thing that the deities expected from a Starlight Knight is complete faith in them and their will to be followed whenever they have a task for the starlight-blessed paladin. It is quite rare for Umi or Ukko to ask something of a Starlight Knight, though it is usually Ukko that will visit an oath-bound paladin for a request.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Starlight
entries: Starting at 7th level, you have proven worthy of being one of the few blessed Starlight Knights and for that, Ukko blesses you with an aura of protection.
You may cast Disguise Self at will, without expending a spell slot and without having to move or speak. You magically make yourself shift form as the stars disguise you and give you a new appearance.

You also emanate an aura while you are not incapacitated. You and any creatures within 10 feet of you are granted resistance to the first radiant and Necrotic Damage they will take in combat. This effect refreshes after a short rest
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: The Cosmos Endures
entries: Starting at 15th level, you understand that the only thing that is eternal are the cosmic bodies that the Astral Siblings created themselves. You understand what it means to be one with the essence of Starlight Magic around you.
You gain a permanent +1 to your AC and the following effects:

rows: As a reaction, you may strike a creature that enters or exits your melee range with 1d6 Radiant Damage.
As a reaction, you may strike a creature that enters or exits your melee range with 1d6 Force Damage.
As a reaction, you may strike a creature that enters or exits your melee range with 1d4 Force Damage.

subclassFeature.name: Champion of the Stars
entries: Starting at 20th level, you have proven yourself as the true champion of Ukko, the Sun God. Ukko and Umi see you as one of their main champions in the realm of the living and empower you as such.

You understand the deep secrets of Starlight Magic around you, allowing you to learn one new Starlight Wizard spell every month. You may cast that spell with the same requirements a wizard would but only once a week per spell learned.
In addtion to that, you also gain the following bonuses:
• You may cast Invisibility as a reaction after being hit by an attack or a spell. This ability recharges the next dawn.

• As a Bonus Action, you may make your Aura of Starlight radiate intensely once a day, harming any targets of your choice that are within its radius. The aura deals 3d6 points of Radiant Damage to anyone who enters its radius or starts their turn in it.
• At the start of your turn, you may force any targets of your choice that are in your Aura's radius to roll a Wisdom saving throw and be blinded on a failed roll.

spell.name: Aether
entries: You pull on the wispy stuff of the Sea of Star's essence and cause it to coalesce in a 5-foot cube within range. The wispy and fluctuating aether causes its area to be heavily obscured. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 1d6} Radiant Damage on a failed saving throw or half as much on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} and the size of the cube increases by 5 feet on each side for every level above 1st.

spell.name: Moonlight Orb
entries: You hurl a 6-inch-diameter, shimmering bright white orb at a creature that you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the target takes {@damage 2d8} Force Damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Starlight Guise
entries: A cloak of pure starlight energy sprouts from your neck and adorns your body. You become resistant to Necrotic or Radiant Damage, chosen when you cast the spell.

spell.name: Sunlight Ray
entries: A beam of bright energy shoots from your hand, moving in a straight 5-foot wide line. Every creature within that line must make a Dexterity Saving Throw. Those who fail take {@damage 1d6} Radiant Damage.
Any target hit by the spell becomes a light source until the caster's next turn, emitting bright light in a 10-foot radius.

spell.name: Tempest Strike
entries: Using a pinch of Starlight energy, you change the electrical magnetic fields in the air, shooting a rail of pure lightning energy towards a target. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d10} Lightning Damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Void Mend
entries: You push into a creature a pure extract of void energy. Sustaining some, corrupting others. A creature you touch that has resistance to Necrotic Damage regains a number of Hit Points equal to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Otherwise, the creature gains resistance to Necrotic Damage. This spell has no effect on constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Void Trance
entries: As you cast this spell, your eyes turn completely black. The next spell that you cast from the necromancy school that does Necrotic Damage does double that damage instead and your targets have disadvantage on their next saving throw against any of your necromancy school spells.

spell.name: Whisper of Chains
entries: You whisper the name of Zas, that mere utterance manifesting the fate of your master into reality. Chains made of shadow and spite. A creature in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have their movement speed halved by the heavy void chain until the spell ends. At the end of a round, a creature chained in this manner takes {@dice 1d4}  necrotic Damage and then it can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

spell.name: Whisper of Torment
entries: You whisper something terrible and ominous and one creature in range of your choosing that can hear it. At the beginning of that creature’s turn, or every 1 minute whichever happens first and for as long the spell lasts, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} Psychic Damage.

spell.name: Radiant Light
entries: Your very body pulsates with raw starlight energy, creating an intense flash of light. All creatures in range must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be Blinded for {@dice 1d6} turns.

spell.name: Solar Benevolence
entries: As you cast this spell, your eyes begin emanating raw starlight power, pulsating with golden energy. The next spell from the Starlight school that you cast that does Radiant Damage does double that damage instead and the next healing spell you cast heals double the healing instead.

spell.name: Ultraviolet
entries: You raise a melee weapon towards Ukko’s sun. Your silent prayer is answered by the Astral Sibling, beaming from the sky ultraviolet energy that empowers that weapon. Whenever it hits, it causes an additional {@damage 3d6} Fire Damage. If it hits a creature that is vulnerable to Radiant Damage, that creature becomes vulnerable to Fire Damage as well until the spell ends.

spell.name: Astral Barrier
entries: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective starlight force surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 14 + its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action. The affected creature shines with a starlight glow when hit by any projectile. The light emitted shines up to 15 feet away.

spell.name: Coronal Impact
entries: A tiny Starlight flicker occurs from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range. Gravity around that point swirls and becomes heavy, reacting with the flicker of Starlight and creating an explosion that resembles those of a star. Each creature in a 5-foot radius sphere centered around the flickering Starlight energy must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 4d6} Radiant Damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The gravitational pull of this tiny star creates difficult terrain for the same sphere area centered around the Starlight energy that remains in existence for one minute

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Whisper of Shards
entries: Whispering half remembered utterances said by Zas itself, you manifest void shards around you, that then fly towards a target in range who must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d10} Necrotic Damage and {@damage 3d10} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d10} Necrotic Damage for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Phoenix Dive
entries: Wings of pure light form around your back, then you fly forth, jubilation and whimsy being the wind blowing at your back. As soon as you cast this spell, you may Fly up to 120 feet in any direction. Once you arrive at your destination, you regain {@dice 1d4} Hit Points equal to every 30 feet you moved in this manner

spell.name: Astral Barrage
entries: You create four glowing bolts of magical force that leave a trail of stardust behind them. Each bolt can hit a different creature of your choice that you can see within range. Each bolt deals {@damage 3d4 + 2} force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several. Any target hit by one of the bolts becomes highlighted until the end of its next turn with a starlight glow and is easy to see in the dark.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the spell creates one more bolt for each slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Whisper of Finality
entries: You whisper the name of one creature in range of your choosing that can hear it. If the creature fails a Wisdom save, they are {@condition charmed} which causes them to spend their next turn attacking themselves with their strongest spell or attack in terms of damage potential. No rolls are necessary, they are successful in their attack action or spellcasting.

spell.name: Whisper of Hunger
entries: You whisper something terrible and ominous and one creature in range of your choosing can hear it. If the creature fails a Wisdom save, an unnatural hunger takes hold. For as long as the spell duration, they suffer 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} every minute they do not eat something.

spell.name: Whisper of Madness
entries: You whisper something utterly bizarre and nonsensical, and one creature in range of your choosing that can hear it. If the creature fails a Wisdom save,it becomes {@condition incapacitated} and spends the duration screaming, laughing, or weeping.

spell.name: Void Siphon
entries: You touch a creature and your hand pierces their flesh, touching their live essence directly. The creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw, if they fail, the void siphons them in a manner chosen by the caster as following:
• Blood Siphon: The target takes {@damage 6d8} Necrotic Damage. You regain that much Hit Points.
• Mind Siphon: You consume a spell slot lower than 5th-level of your choosing from the target, regaining yours and spending theirs.

• Soul Siphon: The target gets {@condition paralyzed} for {@dice 1d4} turns. The caster may act before the creature in the turn order, replacing their original position in the initiative if the target acted before the caster.

spell.name: Whisper of Decay
entries: You whisper about the end of all things and one creature in range of your choosing hears it. If the creature fails a Wisdom save, they begin suffering a curse that springs from the void. At the start of every day, for one year, the creature loses 1 hit point permanently. If the creature kills a sentient being before a day is through, they fight off the curse   omentarily, receiving {@dice 1d4} days where they do not lose 1 hit point permanently.

spell.name: Echo of Dilatation
entries: Clapping your hands together, you produce the sound of an exploding star. In a sphere of 150 feet centered around you, every creature that hears the sound must succeed in a Constitution save or things start moving slowly for them, while you move at regular speed. Every creature affected can only move half their speed, and they have disadvantage on attack rolls against you or unaffected creatures. You and creatures unaffected by the spell have advantage in all attack rolls against creatures affected by the spell. To the creatures affected, they perceive your movement leaving afterimages as you walk by

spell.name: Incinerating Snap
entries: You snap your fingers, from it a flicker of energy is produced and cast forward. Once it travels exactly 30 feet, it explodes in a 30-foot sphere and any creatures in range must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 6d6} Radiant Damage and {@damage 6d6} Fire Damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one

spell.name: Far Sight
entries: You peer across the flow of time to glimpse fragments of possibility moments before they occur. When you cast this spell and as a Bonus Action so long as you maintain {@status concentration}, you may roll {@dice 1d6} and peer into the very near future of that many creatures within sight. When you do so, the GM shares the most immediate course of action that creature will attempt in the next few seconds based on the current situation. In combat, this means the GM will reveal the actions the creature will take on its next turn. This information is played out in a burst of visions. These are only glimpses of possibilities. As such, unforseen events may change the creature's actions before it acts.

spell.name: Child of the siblings
entries: The light of Ukko and Umi guide your quest for justice. After casting the spell, choose an Astral Sibling to assist you:

Ukko: You project a golden aura centered around you with a 60-foot radius. Hostile creatures that start their rounds inside of the aura take {@damage 2d6} Fire Damage. Your melee weapon attacks cause an extra {@damage 1d8} Radiant Damage.

Umi: You project a silvered aura centered around you with a 60-foot radius. Friendly creatures that start their rounds within the aura regain {@dice 1d8} Hit Points. Your melee weapon attacks cause an extra {@damage 1d8} Radiant Damage.

spell.name: Stardust
entries: You sprinkle magical dust around you in a 10-foot radius forcing any creature caught in the spell to become {@condition deafened} until the end of their next turn. This spell does not affect the spellcaster itself.
